intro: Petrocosmea huanjiangensis, commonly known as the Huanjiang petrocosmea, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and ovate, with a glossy surface that reflects light. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
